meanings.definition: Nervous or timid in the company of others.
meanings.sent1: The shy kitten hid behind the couch when visitors arrived.
meanings.sent2: She felt shy when asked to speak in front of the class.
meanings.sent3: The shy squirrel blushed when caught stealing nuts from the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: Her shy smile was like a delicate flower blooming in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The shy deer cautiously peeked out from the bushes, unsure of the strangers nearby.

meanings.definition: To avoid or be reluctant to do something.
meanings.sent1: He would shy away from any task that involved public speaking.
meanings.sent2: The cat would shy away from the vacuum cleaner every time it was turned on.
meanings.sent3: The horse would shy from crossing the bridge, fearing the rushing river below.
meanings.sent4: She would shy away from confrontations, preferring peace and harmony.
meanings.sent5: The child would shy from trying new foods, sticking to familiar favorites.

meanings.definition: To start suddenly or move away in fear.
meanings.sent1: The sudden loud noise made the dog shy away and hide under the table.
meanings.sent2: The bird would shy away from the approaching storm, seeking shelter in the trees.
meanings.sent3: The rabbit would shy at the sight of a snake, darting into its burrow for safety.
meanings.sent4: The deer would shy at the crack of a twig, alert to any potential danger.
meanings.sent5: The child would shy away from the dark, imagining monsters lurking in the shadows.
